column4: why does GRUB say my root partition is in /dev/hda5 when it looks like its in /media/hda5  (either way I cant get it to boot)
Chaos okay.. any idea why it might be hanging and erroring out with a ""ALERT! /dev/hda5 does not exits. Dropping to a shell!""
maybe /dev/hda5 does not exist. how many partitions do you have?
/media/hda5 is a mount point, /dev/hda5 is a device file
and your root partition is the last one??
i think you need to boot /dev/hda1 and add real_root=/dev/hda2 as an option to your kernel
than try all with hde instead of hda
any other hard drives in your system?
what exactly is written in your menu.lst for the item you want to boot?
it also shows ub when you hit "e" while hilighting the entry you want to boot in grub's boot menu
try booting a livecd and mounting your root device and so on, then edit /etc/fstab there
